Definition: Activity for requesting the modification of a set of Configuration Items.
Role played by the Stakeholder in charge of Software Measurement Execution. It does not include automated measurement (by tools).
Example: If Mary (a Person Stakeholder) was in charge of a software measurement execution, then she played the role of measurement executor.

Definition: A Machine where a Loaded Program Copy is running (Program Copy Execution) plays the role of Controller.
Stakeholder with programming skills responsible for producing and documenting the software Code.
Performed Process executed within a Project.
Example: a performed Requirement Process, a performed Construction Process.

Generalizations: SPO:Scheduled Activity   SPMO:Cost Estimated Activity   SPMO:Scope Estimated Activity   SPMO:Duration Estimated Activity   SPO:Project Activity
Definition: A Project Activity with scope, cost, duration and time estimated.
Activity for managing the registered noncompliances until their effective resolution.
Activity for establishing a Baseline embracing a planned set of Configuration Items' Versions.

Softgoal is an initial and temporary vague expression of a goal not suficiently defined yet. It refers to a vague quality region whose exact boundaries are unknown. Thus it is not  possible to determine a priori the set of situations that satisfies the softgoal. Its satisfiability is usually related to an agent's judgement.
Same as UFO::Organization. A Social Agent involving people and other agents and facilities with an arrangement of responsibilities, authorities and relationships.
Example: A company, an enterprise, a software house.

Definition: An Intended Activity defining the time interval it is planned to be performed.
Example: The Requirements Verification and Validation activity scheduled for August 5th to 9th.

Definition: Activity for establishing the Operational Definitions of Measures for the identified Software-Related Measures.
Activity for establishing the configuration management system, usually composed of version control system, a change control system and a product building system.
A document that describes the purpose (structure and functions) of a program in sufficient detail to permit coding and to facilitate maintenance.
Artifact Type which is the powertype of Document, classifying its specializations.
Example: Requirements Document, Design Specification, Project Plan.

Definition: Composite Performed Activity executed for coordinating the Code development and documentation, according to definitions from the Requirements Document and Design Document.
Object intentionally made to serve a given purpose in the context of a software Project or Organization.
Example: a document, a model, a library, an e-mail, a bug.

Definition: Result produced by a Measurement Analysis. An Analysis Result characterizes a Measurable Entity and provides information related to a Measurement Goal.
Example: the analysis of the measured values 26, 25.5 e 24, collected for the measure body mass index in kilos and meters to the measurable entity John could produce the analysis result: The patient’s body mass index decreased from an overweight to a normal weight value and the patient has now a good body mass index. This analysis result characterizes the measurable entity John and provides information to the measurement goal Check if the patient has a good body mass index.

Definition: Activity for verifying that a Baseline or a Deliverable Product is complete, consistent and in conformity with the specified requirements.
Loaded Adaptation Program Copy is the materialization of an Adaptation Program.

Report describing the occurrence, nature, and status of an incident (adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 29119-1:2013 Software and systems engineering--Software testing--Part 1: Concepts and definitions, 4.18).
A Project Process with duration estimated.

Observable State is a situation resulting from the execution of a program copy. It involves qualities and quality values (qualia) of the Machine in which the Loaded Program Copy inheres, as well as of entities residing in that Machine (including the Loaded Program Copy itself).
Activity for managing the building, releasing and delivering of the products to be delivered to clients.

Testing Technique in which the tests are derived from an examination of the structure of the code to be tested (adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 29119-1:2013 Software and systems engineering--Software testing--Part 1: Concepts and definitions)
Simple Performed Activity for designing the Test Cases to be executed, supported by input artifacts.
Standard Process established to be performed in the context of an Organization, regardless of specific Projects.
Example: a standard Portfolio Management Process, a standard Human Resource Hiring Process.

Definition: Activity for establishing and recording the Software Measurement Goals to be included in the Software Measurement Plan.
Interface Specification focusing on the human-computer interaction.
The participation of a Software Product as Resource in a Performed Activity.
Example: the use of the MS Project in a Project Scheduling activity.

Definition: Measure used to quantify a Directly Measurable Element.
Example: the base measure height in meters can be used to quantify the directly measurable element height.

Definition: Piece of software, produced during the software process, not considered a complete Software Product, but an intermediary result.
Example: a component, database schema, a script.

Definition: The actual result obtained from the execution of a test case.
Measurable property that characterizes a Measurable Entity Type.
Example: height is a measurable element that characterizes measurable entities of the Person type.

Definition: Object Kind which is the powertype of Hardware Equipment, classifying its specializations.
Example: Computer, Printer, Router, Keyboard.

Definition: Document describing the configuration management parameters for conducting the process, including the identified Configuration Items types, the configuration systems and the planned Baselines, Configuration Audits, and Products Deliveries.
Hardgoal is a proposition that is objectively satisfied by a given set of situations.
Intended Process defined to be performed within a Project.
Example: a project Requirement Process, a project Construction Process.

Definition: Standard Process that can be part of a General Standard Process of a Project or Organization, necessarily composed of at least two Standard Activities.
Example: the standard Requirements Development Process established as part of a broader standard Development Process.

Definition: Plan Description, recognized by an Organization, which describes a set of Standard Processes.
Example: The whole available description of an organization processes.

Definition: Testing technique in which two or more program mutations are executed using the same test cases to evaluate the ability of the test cases to detect differences in the mutations (ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017 Systems and software engineering-Vocabulary)
Stakeholder responsible for solving a noncompliance.
Document describing the planning of a Project, to be used as the basis for project management.
Activity for reviewing an accomplished change assuring that the modifications were made as planned.

Short program written in a programming language used to test part of the functionality of a software system. Test scripts written as a short program can either be written using a special automated functional GUI test tool or in a well-known programming language (Wikipedia).
Activity for specifying the User Interfaces in detail.
Change Request closed after solved, reviewed and approved.
An Adaptation Program is a RRT Program that intends to satisfy at least one Change Runtime Requirement Artifact.
Document describing how the tests should be performed, providing a roadmap for the testing activities.
Stakeholder responsible for planning and managing the Configuration Management Process.
Document describing the evaluation results and identified issues.
Activity for objectively evaluating the adherence of products and deliverables to the applicable requirements.
Stakeholder that provides needs and expectations for the product.
Example: users, operators, customers, suppliers.

Definition: Intended Activity that is not further decomposed into other Intended Activities.

Activity for documenting Measurement Planning Items. Each Measurement Planning Item includes a Software Measurement Goal Description, an Information Need Description, a Software-Related Measure and an Operational Definition of Measure. Measurement Planning Items produced during the Software Measurement Analysis are part of the Software Measurement Plan produced in that activity.
Type of Measurable Entities related to software.
Example: the Requirements Engineering Standard Process is a measurable software-related entity of the Standard Process type.

Definition: Execution State is the Observable State resulting from the Target Program Copy Execution, which is monitored by some Compliance Program Copy Executions.
Composite Performed Activity executed to solve problems in the requirements and to reach an agreement on the set of requirements to be considered in the Project and their priorities.

An Adaptation Program Copy Execution is the execution of a Loaded Adaptation Program Copy. It uses Change Runtime Requirement Artifacts as resources to triggers changes in its Loaded Target Program Copy.

Action Universal representing a generic activity institutionalized as part of a Standard Process in an Organization, establishing general information such as dependence on other activities, types of artifacts created, changed and used, required software and hardware resources, adopted procedures, and roles to perform it.
Example: Conceptual Modeling, Training Evaluation, Project Risks Planning.

Definition: Method Activity that is not further decomposed into other Method Activities.
Goal that can be used to drive the identification of the Measures needed to provide information in a certain context. Measurement Goals are established based on more general Goals.
Example: in the context of a doctor’s office, a doctor could be the general goal of Taking a good care of the patients. From this general goal, could be established the measurement goal Monitor the patient health, which could be decomposed in others, such as Check if the patient has a good body mass index and Check if the patient has a good blood pressure.

Definition: Stakeholder responsible for conducting reviews in requirements artifacts.
Example: the person in charge of the Requirements Verification and Validation activity.

Definition: Stakeholder responsible for conducting the requirements development activities.
Example: an organization employee assigned as Requirements Engineer in the requirements development activities.

Definition: Activity for making the high-level design choices, defining the Software Architecture and involved elements.
Action performed, in a specific Time Interval, by a Stakeholder, potentially producing and consuming Artifacts, as part of a Specific Performed Process.
Example: Requirement Elicitation, Component Design, Coding, Integration Test, Training Planning.

Definition: Technique for designing test cases. It can be Black-box, White-box, Model-based or Mutation testing techniques, among others.
Software Product ready to be delivered to the client.
Same as UFO::Human Agent A human Physical Agent.
Example: Tim Berners Lee, Dennis Ritchie, Donald Knuth.

Definition: Change Request evaluated and set as authorized or rejected.

Generalizations: UFO:Internal Commitment Universal   UFO:Closed Commitment Universal

Definition: A Standard Process established to be performed within a Project.
Example: a standard Requirement Process, a standard Construction Process.

Definition: Measure used to quantify Measurable Elements of Measurable Software-Related Entities.
Example: the software-related measure number of lines of code could be used to quantify the measurable element size of measurable-related entities of the Software type.

Definition: Activity for refining each Interface Specification of a software.
Composite Performed Activity consisting of testing activities and classified by the different levels they can be performed.
Software Item representing a set of computer instructions and data definitions expressed in a programming language or in a form output by an assembler, compiler, or other translator (SEVOCAB).
Stakeholder responsible for planning and managing the testing activities.

Activity for identifying and recording the Software-Related Measures to be included in the Software Measurement Plan. Software-Related Measures are identified from Information Needs in the sense that Measures must meet the identified Information Needs.
Monitoring Runtime Requirement Artifact defines the criteria for verifying if a requirement is being satisfied or not at runtime.
Each identified release of a Configuration Item submitted to a version control repository.
Example: Project Plan of Project Alfa, version 01, Requirements Document of Project Alfa, version 03.

Definition: Artifact whose configuration is being managed.
Example: Documents, Models, Software Products under Configuration Management.

Definition: Measurement Goal related to software. Software Measurement Goals are based on Business Goals or Software Goals.
Example: the measurement goal Decrease defects in delivered products could be defined based on the software goal Improve software products quality.

Definition: Document pointing out problems identified in the Code during review activities.
A language used to express computer programs.
A collection of test cases that are intended to be used to test a software program to show that it has some specified set of behaviours (Wikipedia).
Stakeholder responsible for designing test cases and analysing test results.
Activity for selecting, among the Software-Related Measures related to the selected Software Measurement Goal the ones to be analyzed in the Software Measurement Analysis.
Artifact Type which is the powertype of Software Product, classifying its specializations.
Example: Modeling Tool, Text Editor, IDE, Compiler.

Definition: Process for conducting the activities related to software configuration management, ensuring the completeness and correctness of software Configuration Items.
Simple Performed Activity executed for documenting the software Code with useful information.
Loaded Program Copy is the materialization of a Program, inhering in a Machine.
Example: a copy of a program loaded in primary memory of my computer.

Definition: Goal that expresses the intention for which strategic actions are planned and performed.
Example: Increase the client’s satisfaction degree.

Definition: Normative Description prescribing a defined way for performing process activities.
Example: an OO Method, the Pair Programming technique, a Project Plan Template.

Definition: Information Item representing the agreement achieved by the Stakeholders, regarding the Requirements for the product.
Example: the agreement on the requirements than can be contained in an e-mail or in a document section.

Definition: Information Item that documents the description of  a Software-Related Measure.
Example: the record of the software-related measure   delivered defects density.

Definition: Document containing the analysis of Test Results and how they succeed.
Quality Universal denoting the types of quality characteristics expected in a software.
Example: reliability, usability, efficiency, maintainability, portability.

Definition: Action that plans the measurement, i.e., determines the Measurement Goals to be monitored, the Information Needs to be considered, the Measures to be collected to meet the Information Needs and the Measurement Procedures to be applied.
Intended Process that is composed of Specific Intended Processes, allowing an Organization or Project to define sub-processes that are part of a complete Intended Process.
Example: the overall Development Process defined for the Alpha Project.

Definition: A Project Activity with its scope in the project defined in terms of the work packages that it shall produce.
A Complex Task is a Task that is composed in other tasks.
Function Universal denoting the types of functions expected in a software.
Example: Controlling client orders.

Definition: Activity for analyzing the selected Measured Values and producing the Analysis Result Description that records the Analysis Result.
Intended Activity composed of other Intended Activities.
A Project Process with duration estimated.

A Goal in the scope of a specific problem, that describes environmental conditions to be achieved through a desired solution resulting in satisfaction of the underlying strategic goals. In GORE, these goals can be refined by decomposing them into sub-goals, as well as by defining them by means of alternative goals.
A Social Role, recognized by the Organization, assigned to Agents when they are hired, included in a team, allocated or participating in activities.
Example: System Analyst, Designer, Programmer, Client Organization.

Definition: Value that compose a Scale.
Example: 0.5, 1, 1.8 are examples of values that compose the scale of the measure height in meters.

Definition: Stakeholder responsible for making the Detailed Design choices for a software.
Procedure applicable to a Measure and that describe the steps to be carried out to collect data for it.
Example: Measurement procedure to collect data for the measure weight in kilos: Use a weighting digital instrument to measure the person weight in kilos. Record the measured value and the measurement date.

Definition: Software product that manages and maintains lists of issues as needed by an organization (adapted from Wikipedia).
Goal that is not composed by others.
Example: Monitor the patient’s blood pressure.

Definition: Systematic Procedure defining a workflow of activities (a set of steps) and heuristics to perform one or more activities.
Example: an OO Method, an Interview Method.

Definition: Specific Performed Process for establishing and developing the requirements for a system or software.
Change Request in the first phase, communicated.
Simple Performed Activity executed for developing the software Code according to previews definitions.
Physical Object used for running software programs or to support some related action.
Example: Computer Dell I7, Laser Printer HP, Smartphone Galaxy 7, Router Linksys Wi-fi.

Definition: Activity for analyzing Measured Values collected for Software-Related Measures aiming to characterize a Software-Related Measurable Entity and provide information related to a Software Measurement Goal.
Example: a software measurement analysis that analyzed the measured values 0.75, 0.9 e 1, collected for the measure schedule performance index to characterize the software-related measurable entity Project P.

Definition: An RRT Program is a Program that is built intending to satisfy at least one Runtime Requirement Artifact.
Action that analyzes Measure Values collected for Measures aiming to characterize a Measurable Entity and provide information related to a Measurement Goal.
Example: a measurement analysis could analyze the measured values 26, 25.5 e 24, collected for the measure body mass index in kilos and meters to characterize the measurable entity John.

Definition: Design Time Requirement Artifact is a Requirement Artifact written in natural language or other format that could not be processed by a program at runtime. It is a Requirement Artifact to be used during design time.
Information Item that records a Measured Value.
Example: the record of the measured value 0.75.

Definition: Stakeholder responsible for conducting objective evaluations.
Stakeholder responsible for reviewing the Code according to the Requirements Document and Design Document.
Activity for producing a detailed Data Model for data storage and management.
Testing technique in which the test cases are derived from a model that describes the system under test.
Complex Action Universal representing any generic process in an Organization (formalized or not), which is the powertype of every Performed Process.
Example: a formalized Standard Process (e.g. Development Process), a non-formalized generic process (e.g. Reuse Process).

Definition: Social Object produced during Measurement Planning. A Measurement Planning Item specifies a Measurement Goal to be monitored, an Information Need to be considered, a Measure to be used to meet the Information Need and a Measurement Procedure to be applied to collect data for the Measure. Several Measurement Planning Items can be produced during Measurement Planning.
Example: the measurement planning item specifying the measurement goal Check if the patient has a good body mass index, the information need What is the patient body mass index?, the measure body mass index in kilos and meters to be collected by using the measurement procedure Obtain the values measured to the measures weight in grams and and height in centimeters considering a same measurement date, apply the measurement formula to calculate the body mass index in kilos and meters, record the measured value and the measurement date.

Definition: Goal that expresses the intention for which software-related actions are planned and performed. Software Goals are based on Business Goals.
Example: the software goal Improve software products quality could be defined based on the business goal Increase the client’s satisfaction degree.

Definition: Standard Process that is composed of Specific Standard Processes, allowing an Organization to establish sub-processes that are part of a complete Standard Process.
Example: the overall Development Process established for the Organization Projects.

Definition: Intention (Internal Commitment) representing the process defined to be performed in a specific project or organizational area, considering its particularities.
Example: Testing, Measurement, Strategic Planning intended processes.

Definition: Activity for formally controlling the modification of Configuration Items, in a process of requesting, evaluating, changing and reviewing.
Organization interested or affected by the process activities or results.
Example: a Client Organization.

Definition: Activity for evaluating a Design Document, registering the identified issues.

Scale in which it is possible to quantify the distance between its Scale Values and there is not a value to represent nonentity (absolute zero). In an Interval Scale, although it is possible to quantify the distance between Scale Values, it is not possible to establish other relations between them.
Example: the measure temperature in Celsius degree has an interval scale, since it is possible to quantify the distance between its scale values (e.g., there are 10o between the temperatures 20oC and 30oC), 0oC does not mean the absence of temperature and it is not possible to establish relations between scale values (e.g., we cannot say that 50oC is twice hotter than 25oC).

Definition: Activity for objectively evaluating the adherence of processes and products to the applicable requirements, registering the identified issues.

Activity for selecting the Software Measurement Plan Item to be used to guide the Software Measurement Execution. The selected Software Measurement Plan Item indicates the Software-Related Measured to be applied in the Software Measurement Execution and the Operational Definition of Measure to be considered.
Measurable Entity related to software.
Example: a software project,  a standard process.

Definition: Formula that quantifies relations between Measures from which a Derived Measure is obtained.
Example: the measure body mass index in kilos and meters (BMI) can be calculated from the measures weight in kilos (w) and height in meters (h) by applying the measurement formula BMI = w/(h*h).

Definition: Software Item that aims at satisfying a specification (System Specification), concerning a desired change in a data structure inside a computer, abstracting away from the behavior.
Stakeholder responsible for implementing a change in Configuration Items.
Information Item that records the Analysis Result produced in a Software Measurement Analysis.
Example: the record of the analysis result: the schedule performance index of the Project P has improved in the last three months and the project is now adherent to the agreed schedule.

Definition: The overall Performed Process executed in a specific Project or Organization, which is necessarily composed of Specific Performed Processes.
Example: the overall process performed in a software project.

Definition: Activity for identifying and recording the Information Needs to be included in the Software Measurement Plan. Information Needs are identified from the established Software Measurement Goals.
Procedure applied to analyze Measured Values obtained for a Software-Related Measure.
Goal that is composed by others.
Example: the complex goal Monitor the patient health could be decomposed in Check if the patient has a good body mass index and Check if the patient has a good blood pressure.

Definition: Artifact Participation in which a new Artifact is created.
Example: the creation of the source Code as part of a Coding activity.

Definition: Anything that can be measured.
Example: a person, a project, an organization.

Definition: Activity for refining each Architectural Component of a software.
Activity for performing the authorized changes in a set of Configuration Items under version control.
Stakeholder responsible for requesting a change in Configuration Items.
Process objectively evaluated.
Social Agent representing a group of people with a defined purpose.
Example: a Testing team, a Quality Assurance team, a Deployment team.

Definition: Complex Action, composed of other processes or activities, performed in a specific Time Interval, for reaching a goal in a Project or Organization.
Example: Development, Configuration Management, Training performed processes.

Definition: An Intended Process defining the Time Interval it is planned to be performed.
Example: The Requirements Development Process defined for the Alpha Project and scheduled for July 1st to August 15th.

Definition: Level-based Testing focusing on the unit or the individual components that have been developed, ensuring that the unit functions correctly in isolation.
Artifact objectively evaluated.
Change Runtime Requirement Artifact specifies changes on the system's behavior, in order for the software system to keep fulfilling the goals it has been designed for.
Activity for finishing a noncompliance once it is satisfactorily solved.
Architectural Element connecting two or more Components in an Architecture.
Software Product when used as Resource of some process activity.
Example: the Eclipse IDE being used by the Coding activity.

Definition: Specific Performed Process for conducting the activities related to software Code production.

Action that measures a Measurable Element of a Measurable Entity by applying a Measure and adopting a Measurement Procedure to obtain a Measured Value. A Measurement is performed based on a Measurement Planning Item.
Example: the measurement of the measurable element weight of the measurable entity John by applying the measure weight in kilos, adopting a certain measurement procedure and resulting in the measured value 75.

Definition: Type of entities that can be measured.
Example: John is a measurable entity of the type Person.

Definition: Intended Process that is part of the General Intended Process of a Project or Organization, necessarily composed of at least two Intended Activities.
Example: the Construction Process defined for a specific project, the Training Process defined for an organizational OO training.

Definition: Performed Process that is part of the General Performed Process of a Project or Organization, necessarily composed of at least two Performed Activities.
Example: the Project Management Process performed in a specific project, the Portfolio Management Process performed in an organization.

Definition: Document registering the planed quality assurance activities, processes and artifacts to be evaluated and involved personnel.
The intention of Requirements Stakeholders that defines requirements to be achieved.
Architectural Element describing a software module as part of an Architecture.

Measurement Planning Item related to software. It is an Information Item produced during Software Measurement Planning and it is composed of a Software Measurement Goal Description, an Information Need Description, a Measure Description and an Operational Definition of Measure.
Example: the software measurement planning item composed of the software measurement goal description Decrease defects in delivered products, the information need description What is the delivered defects density?, the measure description delivered defects density and an operational definition of measure established to the software-related measure delivered defects density.

Definition: Team interested or affected by the process activities or results.
Example: a Testing Team.

Definition: Intention (Internal Commitment) representing the activity defined to be performed as part of an Intended Process, by a defined role, potentially consuming and producing artifacts, using resources and adopting procedures.
Example: Unit Testing, Measure Collection, Strategic Goals Definition.

Definition: Runtime Requirement Artifact is a Requirement Artifact written in a computational file that could be processed by a program at runtime (RRT Program Copy Execution).
Performed Activity that is not further decomposed into other Performed Activities.
Level-based Testing focusing on the behavior of the entire system, ensuring that it is in conformance with its requirements.
Scale whose Scale Values can be mapped to a certain order or ranking.
Example: the measure client satisfaction degree, which can be mapped to the values “high”, “medium” or “low”, has an Ordinal Scale.

Definition: Procedure that provides heuristics to perform an activity (but in a less rigid and detailed way than a method, since it does not prescribe a set of activities).
Example: White-box testing, Pair programming.

Definition: Major types of testing techniques such as black-box, white-box, model-based and mutation testing techniques.
Function used to associate a value (Measured Value) to a Measurable Element of a Measurable Entity. Measures quantify Measurable Elements and characterize Measurable Entity Types.
Example: the measure height in meters can be used to quantify the measurable element height of measurable entities of the type Person.

Definition: Activity for establish the high-level choices regarding the software data.
Example: data management mechanisms, data distribution.

Definition: Information Needs are identified from Measurement Goals and determine which information have to be met by Measures in order to monitor the achievement of the related Measurement Goal.
Example: the information need What is the patient body mass index? could be identified from the measurement goal Check if the patient has a good body mass index.

Definition: Activity for accessing defined versions of Configuration Items from a version control repository, usually for changing purposes.
Simple Performed Activity for analyzing Test Results to determine whether or not tests have been successful in identifying defects.
Non-Functional Requirement referring to a Quality Characteristic of the software product.
Example: Being accessible from some specific browsers, Performing a function in an established time.

Definition: Activity for defining the Software Measurement Plan structure, its initial information (e.g., organization to which it was defined and elaboration date) and starting its elaboration.
A Task is a plan to achieve a goal.
Model containing the physical and logical decisions on how to manage and storage the software data.
Example: a database schema.

Definition: A Software Measurement Plan defined for a Project.
Example: the Software Project Measurement Plan defined for the Project P.

Definition: Change Request being solved after authorization.

Testing technique that ignores the internal mechanism of a system or component and focuses solely on the outputs generated in response to selected inputs and execution conditions (adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017 Systems and software engineering-Vocabulary)
A Social Object as a temporary endeavor undertaken to create a unique product, service, or result.
Example: A project to produce a software on demand.

Definition: Artifact Participation in which an existing Artifact is used, but not modified.
Example: the usage of a Design Specification in a Coding activity.

Definition: Change Request solved through the Change Implementation.
Standard Activity that is not further decomposed into other Standard Activities.
Document containing the actual results and identified issues relative to a Test Case execution.
Information Item that documents the description of a Software Measurement Goal.
Example: the record of the software measurement goal Decrease defects in delivered products.

Definition: Program Copy Execution is an Event representing the execution of the Loaded Program Copy running in a Machine. In other words, the Program Copy Execution is the event of the physical manifestation of the dispositions (represented as the complex disposition Loaded Program Copy) that inhere in the Machine.
Value obtained in a Measurement.
Example: the measured value 75 obtained in the measurement of the measurable element weight of the measurable entity John by applying the measure weight in kilos.

Definition: Information Item describing an internal or external interface of a software architecture.
Information Item describing a Requirement.
Example: "The system shall provide a product register.", "The system shall control the client orders.", "The system shall be operable from Google Chrome version 32+."

Definition: An RRT Program Copy Execution is the execution of a Loaded RRT Program Copy. It uses Runtime Requirement Artifacts as resources.
Artifact Participation in which an existing Artifact is modified.
Example: the change of the source Code as part of a Coding activity fixing a bug in it.

Definition: Standard Process established to be performed in the context of a Project or Organization.
Example: a Training Process, a Quality Auditing Process.

Definition: Action type representing one of the steps of a Method Workflow.
Example: the Classes Identification activity of an OO Method.

Definition: Process for conducting the activities related to software quality assurance, assessing and assuring adherence of the performed processes and produced artifacts to the applicable requirements.
A Project Activity with cost estimated.
Loaded Compliance Program Copy is the materialization of a Compliance Program.
A representation (abstraction) of a process or system from a particular perspective.
Example: a use case model, a class model, a component model.

Definition: Measurable Element that does not depend on others to be measured.
Example: weight and height.

Definition: Stakeholder responsible for reviewing the changes in Configuration Items regarding a Change Request.
Simple Performed Activity executed for reviewing the software Code to identify errors and non-conformances.
Standard Activity composed of other Standard Activities.
Agent (Person, Team or Organization) interested or affected by the process activities or results.
Example: an Analyst, a Programmer, a User, a Testing Team, a Client Organization.

Definition: The result expected from the execution of a test case.

Scale in which it is possible to quantify the distance between its Scale Values, there is a value to represent nonentity (absolute zero) and it is possible to establish relations between Scale Values.
Example: the measure distance in kilometers has a rational scale, since 0km means the absence of distance, it is possible to quantify the distance between scale values (e.g., there are 10km between the distances 20km and 30km) as well as establish other relations between them (e.g., we can say that 100km is twice longer than 50km).

Definition: Software item used to invoke a module under test and, often, provide test inputs, control and monitor execution, and report test results (adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017 Systems and software engineering-Vocabulary).
Action Universal representing any generic activity in an Organization (formalized or not), which is the powertype of every Performed Activity.
Example: a formalized standard Requirements Elicitation activity, a non-formalized generic (alternative) Requirements Elicitation activity.

Definition: Loaded Target Program Copy is the materialization of a Target Program.
Simple Performed Activity for implementing the Test Cases as Code artifacts (Test Code) to be used during Test Execution.
Copy of an Artifact that is under version control.
Model describing the fundamental structures of a software, including its components, how they are connected, and its internal and external interfaces.
Activity for evaluating the Change Request for a set of Configuration Items, authorizing or rejecting it.
Specific Performed Process for planning and executing the dynamic testing activities for the software in development.
The set of resources (Hardware and Software Resources) that are used to perform testing activities of a Project.
Simple Performed Activity for effectively executing the Test Cases, by running the Test Code and producing the Test Results.
Information Item that documents the description of an Information Need.
Example: the record of the information need What is the delivered defects density?.

Definition: Software Functions are functional dispositions that constitute the complex disposition Loaded Program Copy. Each Software Function is an instance of a Software Function Universal. When the software development process is accomplished correctly, the Software Functions that constitute the Loaded Program Copy are instances of the exact Software Function Universals described by the Program Specification and successfully implemented by the Program.
Model describing the Product Requirements under different and relevant views.
Example: a class diagram.

Definition: Model Element referring to an Architectural Component or Connector, and its Interfaces.
Composite Performed Activity executed for evaluating Documented Requirements and Conceptual Models registered in Requirements Documents, and for recording the identified problems.
Performed Process executed in the context of an Organization, regardless of specific Projects.
Example: a performed Portfolio Management Process, a performed Human Resource Hiring Process.

Definition: Activity for planning the quality assurance activities, resulting in a Quality Assurance Plan.
Information Item describing an action to eliminate the cause or reduce the likelihood of recurrence of a detected nonconformity or other undesirable situation. [ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765]
Example: an additional developer shall be allocated for Project X, a new agreement on the requirements change shall be obtained from the client.

Definition: Measure used to quantify an Indirectly Measurable Element.
Example: the measure body mass index in kilos and meters can be used to quantify the indirectly measurable element body mass index.

Definition: Change Request reviewed to check if the modifications done are correct.
Role played by the Stakeholder in charge of Software Measurement Analysis.
Example: If John (a Person Stakeholder) was in charge of a software measurement analysis, then he played the role of measurement analyst.

Definition: Measurement Procedure applicable to a Derived Measure.
Example: Measurement procedure to collect data for the measure body mass index in kilos and meters: Obtain the values measured to the measures weight in kilos and and height in meters considering a same measurement date.  Apply the measurement formula to calculate the body mass index in kilos and meters. Record the measured value and the measurement date.

Definition: Software Product or Hardware Equipment when used by a process activity.
Example: a Smartphone being used by a Testing activity.

Definition: Activity for refining a preliminary software design to the extent that it is sufficiently complete to be implemented. [ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765]
Requirement defining a function to be available in the product being built.
Example: The need for the system to control client orders.

Definition: Composite Performed Activity executed for modeling requirements, producing Conceptual Models that provide a more comprehensive view of the problem.

Skeletal or special-purpose test code substituting a software module, used to test a module that calls or is otherwise dependent on it (adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017 Systems and software engineering - Vocabulary)
Composite Performed Activity executed for identifying requirements from the Stakeholders and other sources, and documenting them.
Measure directly used to indicate the achievement of Measurement Goals.
Example: the measure body mass index in kilos and meters could play the role of indicator when indicating the achievement of the measurement goal Check if the patient has a good body mass index.

Definition: Information Item describing the high-level choices of how the software will manage data.
Code produced for implementing a Test Case.
Document reporting the results of a Quality Audit Performing, including Noncompliance and Corrective Action Registers.
Any written or pictorial, uniquely identified, information related to the software development, usually presented in a predefined format.
Example: a Requirements Document, a specification, a report.

Definition: Situation in which a Software Measurement Execution was performed.
Example: an example of measurement context for a software measurement execution that obtained the measured value 0.75 for the software-related measure schedule performance index to the Project P could be: measurement performed one month after substituting two of the team members with two members less experienced.

Definition: Document pointing out problems identified in Documented Requirements and Conceptual Models registered in a Requirements Document.
Information Item describing a request for modification on a set of Configuration Items.
Example: a request for changing the project planning replacing a developer, which affects the Project Plan and the Project Schedule.

Definition: Artifact that is not decomposed into other Artifacts.
Activity for collecting and storing data for the Software-Related Measure indicated in the selected Software Measurement Plan Item.
Target Program is the role a Program plays when it is the targer of a RRT Program, i.e., the RRT Program are built to act over (monitor/change) the Target Program.
Information Item describing a noncompliance (a failure or refusal to conform to an applicable requirement) in a process or artifact, and related information to solve it.
Example: a neglected activity in a process, a document wrongly specified.

Definition: Activity for planning the Configuration Management Process, including, among others, the Configuration Management System Establishment and the Configuration Items Identification.
A Project Process with cost estimated.
Activity for analyzing a noncompliance, planning and executing the applicable corrective actions to its resolution.
Levels in which testing activities are performed, such as Unit, Integration and System testing.
Document specifying the design of a software, by depicting the software architecture, components, interfaces and data models, as well as other information regarding the design choices and decisions.
Intended Activity defined to be performed within a Project, and thus that is part of a Project Process.
Example: a project Requirement Process, a project Construction Process.

Definition: Process for defining and specifying a solution to be implemented for a software product, considering the requirements for it. It is a refinement process starting with the software architecture, and going down to the design of its elements, interfaces, and other characteristics of a software, until achieving the design of implementation units.
Unit in which measures can be expressed.
Example: meter, kilo, hour.

Definition: Activity for communicating the Analysis Result Description to the relevant Stakeholders.
Object Kind which is the powertype of Artifact, classifying its specializations.
Example: Document, Model, Software Product, Information Item, Software Item.

Definition: Role played by the Stakeholder in charge of Software Measurement Planning.
Example: If John (a Person Stakeholder) was in charge of a software measurement planning, then he played the role of measurement manager.

Definition: Activity for planning the software measurement, i.e., for determining the Software Measurement Goals to be monitored, the Information Needs to be considered, the Software-Related Measures to be collected to meet the Information Needs and the Operational Definition of Measure to be considered.
Requirement defining criteria or capabilities for the product.
Example: Being accessible from some specific browsers, Being in conformance with a standard, Performing a function in an established time.

Definition: Activity for registering the architectural and detailed design choices and decisions, producing a Design Document.
Composite Performed Activity for planning how the testing activities should be performed, and documenting it in a Test Plan.
The participation of an Artifact in a Performed Activity.
Example: when an artifact is created, changed or used by an activity.

Generalizations: SPMO:Duration Estimated Process   SPMO:Cost Estimated Process   SPO:Scheduled Process   SPO:Project Process
Definition: A Project Process with cost, duration and time estimated.

Complex Action Universal representing a generic process institutionalized in an Organization, establishing basic requirements for Intended Processes to be performed in that Organization or in its Projects.
Example: Development, Training, Acquisition standard processes.

Definition: Document registering the issues identified in a Design Document evaluation.
Loaded RRT Program Copy is the materialization of a RRT Program.
Method Activity composed of other Method Activities.
Hardware Equipment when used as Resource of some process activity.
Example: a specific Computer Dell I7 being used by the Project Planning activity.

Definition: One or more computer programs together with any accompanying auxiliary items, such as documentation, delivered under a single name, ready for use.
Example: Astah modeling tool, Microsoft Word, Eclipse IDE.

Definition: Document composed of Documented Requirements and related information, as a basis for other technical software processes, including maintenance.
Example: the Requirements Document of the Alfa Project.

Definition: Stakeholder responsible for coding and executing test cases.
Level-based Testing focusing on larger components, ensuring that a collection of units functions as desired.
Stakeholder responsible for designing the Software Architecture.
Artifact composed of other Artifacts.
Activity for measuring a Software-Related Measurable Entity by applying a Software-Related Measure and obtaining a Measured Value.
Example: the software measurement execution that applied the software-related measure schedule performance index to measure the Project P and obtained the measured value 0.75.

Definition: The belief of Requirements Stakeholders regarding the environment of interest that are described in terms of Assumptions.

Concept: Selection of Measurement Goals for Analysis
Definition: Activity for selecting the Software Measurement Goal to be monitored by using information provided by the Software Measurement Analysis.
Complex Action type denoting a set of steps (Method Activities) to be used when a Method is adopted.
Example: the steps for using a OO Method for the software design phase.

Definition: Activity for objectively evaluating the adherence of processes and activities to the applicable requirements.
Machine is a hardware equipament able to run programs.
Descriptions of the parameters and values to be used in a test case, in order to produce an expected result.
Social Relator representing a Stakeholder allocated to perform a Scheduled Activity acting an Organizational Role.
Example: the allocation of Mary as a Project Manager to perform the scheduled Project Planning activity.

Definition: Computer instructions and data definitions expressed in a form output by an assembler, compiler, or other translator, which can be recognized by the processing unit of a computer machine.
Intended Process defined to be performed in the context of an Organization, regardless of specific Projects.
Example: an intended Portfolio Management Process, a intended Human Resource Hiring Process.

Definition: Document produced during Software Measurement Planning. It is composed of Software Measurement Planning Items.
Example: the Software Measurement Plan defined for the Organization O.

Definition: Stakeholder responsible for managing a Project.
Stakeholder responsible for auditing the Configuration Management related results.
Goal to be achieved, representing a condition or capacity needed for the system users for solving a problem.
Example: Providing a product register, Performing a function in an established time.

Definition: The participation of a Stakeholder in a Performed Activity, playing an Organizational Role.
Example: Mary acting as Programmer in a Coding Activity, the Quality Assurance Team acting as an Auditor in an Auditing activity.

Definition: A Target Program Copy Execution is the execution of a Loaded Target Program Copy. It brings about to an Execution State.

Information Item that specifies information regarding data collection and analysis of a Software-Related Measure. An Operational Definition of Measure indicates: Measurement Procedure, Measurement Periodicity, Measurement Moment, Measurement Responsible, Measurement Analysis Procedure, Measurement Analysis Periodicity, Measurement Analysis Moment, and Measurement Analysis Responsible.

Software Item which aims at producing a certain result through execution on a computer, in a particular way, given by the Program Specification. A Program is constituted by code, but it is not identical to code. Code can be changed without altering the identity of its program, which is anchored to the program's essential property: its intended specification (Program Specification).

Activity for selecting the Software-Related Measurable Entity to be measured in the Software Measurement Execution. The selected entity type must be the Software-Related Measurable Entity Type indicated in the Operational Definition of Measure defined in the selected Software Measurement Plan Item.
The participation of a Stakeholder as the main responsible for a Performed Activity, playing an Organizational Role.
Example: Mary acting as the Project Manager in a Project Control activity.

Definition: The participation of a Hardware Equipment as a Resource in a Performed Activity.
Example: the use of a specific Computer in a Coding activity.

Definition: Activity for registering the noncompliances identified in processes and artifacts.
Software Resource that comprises the Testing Environment of a Project.
Procedure aiming to establish a uniform way for preparing a Document, providing a predefined format and a defined structure for filling with the expected information.
Example: Project Plan Template, Test Report Template.

Definition: A well-formed sequence of computer instructions and data definitions expressed in a programming language, in a form suitable for input to an assembler, compiler, or other translator.
Activity for specifying the Interfaces between Architectural Components and with external elements (users or other systems).
Stakeholder interested in a particular Project.
Example: the Project Team, the Project Client.

Definition: Relevant information for human use, produced or used by Performed Activity.
Example: a documented requirement, a bug reported, an agreement e-mail, a component description.

Definition: Activity for closing a reviewed and approved Change Request.
Hardware Resource that comprises the Testing Environment of a Project.

Assumptions describe states-of-affairs in the environment of interest that the Stakeholders believe to be true, i.e., they are the propositional content of Stakeholders' Beliefs. They express the belief that a specific situation exists in the environment.
Performed Activity composed of other Performed Activities.
Activity for including new Versions of Configuration Items into a version control repository.
Document containing the input data, expected results, steps and general conditions for testing some situation regarding a Code To Be Tested.
Measurable Element that depends on others (its sub-elements) to be measured.
Example: body mass index is an indirectly measurable element measured from weight and height.

Definition: Activity for implementing the changes requested and approved for a Configuration Item.
Stakeholder responsible for evaluating if a Change Request should be implemented or not.
A Project related to software development or maintenance.
Measurement Procedure applicable to a Base Measure.
Example: Measurement procedure to collect data for the measure weight in kilos: Use a weighting digital instrument to measure the person weight in kilos. Record the measured value and the measurement date.

Definition: Information Item packaging a set of Configuration Items' Versions at a specific time in the product's life (for a product delivery or to establish a relevant point in the Project).
Example: Release 01 Baseline, established for the first delivered product for the client, Planning baseline, established after project planning is established and agreed.

Definition: A Compliance Program Copy Execution is the execution of a Loaded Compliance Program Copy. It uses Monitoring Runtime Requirement Artifacts as resources to monitor Execution States.

Generalizations: SPO:Performed Composite Activity   SPO:Performed Simple Activity
Definition: Activity aiming to produce the Software Architecture and specifying its Architectural Components and Connectors.
Portion of Code (software module) to be tested by a Test Case.
Object whose configuration may be managed.
Example: Artifacts, Process descriptions, Tools.

Definition: Software Product used to store information on how testing is to be done, plan testing activities and report the status of testing activities (adpated from Wikipedia).
Delimitates the space of values possible to be associated by a Measure to a Measurable Element.
Example: the scale of the measure height in meters is a liner structure isomorphic to the positive half-line of the real numbers.

Definition: An Atomic Task is a Task that is not decomposed in other tasks.
Person interested or affected by the process activities or their results.
Example: an Analyst, a Programmer, a User.

Definition: The participation of a Procedure in a Performed Activity.
Example: the adoption of an Interview Technique in a Requirements Elicitation activity.

Definition: Report describing any event that occurs during the testing process which requires investigation (adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017 Systems and software engineering-Vocabulary)
Activity for selecting the Measured Values of the selected Software-Related Measures to be analyzed in the Software Measurement Analysis.

The Software Measurement Process is a Process with the purpose of collecting, analyzing, and reporting data relating to the products developed and the processes used to develop them, aiming to support effective processes management and objectively demonstrate products quality.

Composite Performed Activity executed for recording Documented Requirements and related Conceptual Models in Requirements Documents, assuring proper recording and management of them during and after the project.
Some Artifact defined as an input for the Test Case Design.
Example: Requirements Document, Design Document, Code.

Definition: Object whose configuration is being managed.
Example: Artifacts, Process descriptions, Tools under Configuration Management.

Definition: Compliance Program is a RRT Program that intends to satisfy at least one Monitoring Runtime Requirement Artifact.
Activity for identifying the Configuration Items of a Project.
